metadata.name: LSASS Process Dump Artefact In CrashDumps Folder
metadata.comment: Detects the presence of an LSASS dump file in the "CrashDumps" folder. This could be a sign of LSASS credential dumping. Techniques such as the LSASS Shtinkering have been seen abusing the Windows Error Reporting to dump said process.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('3') AND startswith(lower(file.path), lower('c:\\windows\\system32\\config\\systemprofile\\appdata\\local\\crashdumps\\')) AND contains(lower(file.path), lower('lsass.exe.')) AND endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.dmp')))

output.summary: Detects the presence of an LSASS dump file in the "CrashDumps" folder. This could be a sign of LSASS credential dumping. Techniques such as the LSASS Shtinkering have been seen abusing the Windows Error Reporting to dump said process.

metadata.objective: False positive: Rare legitimate dump of the process by the operating system due to a crash of lsass References: https://github.com/deepinstinct/Lsass-Shtinkering, https://media.defcon.org/DEF%20CON%2030/DEF%20CON%2030%20presentations/Asaf%20Gilboa%20-%20LSASS%20Shtinkering%20Abusing%20Windows%20Error%20Reporting%20to%20Dump%20LSASS.pdf
